highlights: Added a portfolio of features to a new regulatory reporting application using React and Java Spring Boot on top of an Oracle SQL database, expanding the app's functionality for a previously unserviced user group.
Ensured stability and smooth functionality in production environments by resolving critical defects causing application-wide failures and taking part in thorough end-to-end testing.
Streamlined the manual process of determining a customers eligibility of lease to loan conversion with 1600 requests processed to date with 0 production defects.
Accomplished this by developing a new AWS EKS microservice with Java Spring Boot and added system observability with Splunk and Datadog.

Reduced time waiting for team communication by about 3 hours per week by creating a serverless Python and React.js web app on AWS Lambda with a centralized DynamoDB database to share a history of manual API tests and define API specifications as they change.
Ensured the project's alignment with user needs through frequent meetings and presentations with users and other stakeholders.
Created a web-based dashboard for monitoring supercomputer resources using Ruby on Rails.
Delivered a multitude of assorted features and bug fixes for the OpenOndemand platform, empowering researchers to seamlessly interface with Linux supercomputers through a user-friendly web interface.

Created a fast and efficient data storage system for over 100k unique users every day by architecting and implementing the MongoDB database, Express.js backend API, and connecting client code for monkeytype.com.
Reduced operating costs by 70 percent and slowed the rate of increasing cloud service costs by identifying and correcting inefficient system architecture and processes.

projects.name: mathgenerator
projects.description: Created and maintain an open-source Python package that enables generating a wide variety of math exercises. Featured on YC Hacker News, reaching rank 3 on the front page. Has over 300 downloads per month and over 500 stars on Github.

projects.name: Stem Player Online
projects.description: Created a web application that enables users to creatively play music by isolating instruments from songs and giving users the power to loop, change the speed of, and add effects to their music. Used by around 3000 people per month.

projects.name: 3cards
projects.description: Created a web3 application that allows users to create and share flashcard sets at 0 cost. Powered by Arweave, a decentralized blockchain-like storage network. Winner in the Arweave Open Web Hackathon.

projects.name: Congol
projects.description: Created a website that allows users to play a version of Conway's Game of Life with 2 players competing live over the internet.

volunteer.organization: Competitive Programming Club at Ohio State
highlights: Organized competitive programming competitions at OSU for over 500 participants across 4 events.
Rank in the top 5 competitors at OSU, placing 1st and 3rd in ICPC regional competitions for 2022 and 2023 respectively.
